name: Old Waterstreet Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fantastic as was the food and our host. They've got something very good going out there!
reviews.title: This is why I love a good bed and breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful one night stay at the Old Waterstreet Inn's Cortland Room! Breakfast was positively declicious and I really appreciated that it was not fat and calorie laden like so many b&b breakfasts. Our first course was fruit with a great setup of being able to add as much or as little yogurt and toppings (granola, raisins, coconut) as desired. The next course was banana & walnut pancakes with real maple syrup and chicken & apple sausage--again, delicious. During our stay at the inn, there were always snacks (cookies, pretzels, snack mix) and sodas available, as well as chocolate and a carafe of water in our room.
reviews.title: Charming Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Besides being fantastic cooks, Jeannie and Erik are wonderful hosts and full of helpful advice and recommendations. They've thoughtfully turned the inn into a charming and comfortable place to relax--the upstairs sitting room was a favorite. The common rooms were filled with great books, particularly those good for short reading or local attractions. Our room was beautiful, exactly as pictured on the web site. We checked out all of the rooms at the innkeepers' suggestion since we were the only guests and they all looked fantastic--we'll probably book the Cottage Inn Suite next time since it's so cozy and private.
reviews.title: Great location and a beautiful home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For proximety to the downtown pedestrian mall, the location can't be beat. We came specifically for dinner (and lots of wine!) at One Block West and The Old Waterstreet Inn's location three blocks away was perfect.
reviews.title: Fantastic as Always!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One final note--the innkeepers have taken many steps towards reducing waste and recycling while still creating a feeling of luxury and hospitality. The full sized bath products and makeup remover were fantastic!
reviews.title: Perfect weekend away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great and the house was quite nice. We stayed in the cottage suite (top floor...many stairs) which was nice because it had a sitting room included. One caution on the bathroom...I'm tall and the ceiling slopes down so you have to stand close to the shower head or your head will hit the ceiling. I would suggest that the owner put window coverings on the windows (the lights from outside ...traffic and street...shine into the room). The breakfast was quite ordinary...just OK but we enjoyed the company at the inn.
reviews.title: Nice B&B

reviews.text: I had a rare window of opportunity to take a day off and get away for a long weekend, so called and was fortunate to get their last room available! Easy to find, with its own parking, in old town Wincester, within a few blocks of several museums, a very nice local library, and lots of restaurants along a pedestrian street. The house was beautiful, everything in perfect order, and quiet and restful! And the breakfasts were excellent - enough to have a late lunch/early dinner and have two meals a day instead of three! Erik & Jeannie were hospitable yet provided ample privacy. I recommend it for a nice getaway or a weekend playing tourist in a historic town.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to relax and easy walking distance to restaurants, museums and shops
Wonderful!!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a few nights right after we were married, and I can't say enough great things about this place. Jeannie and Erik were both fantastic and since my wife and I are wine lovers, we got great recommendations for which wineries to go to. Dinner reservations were booked for us, and the place was spotless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Lovely B&B with all the amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A traditional B&B, owner-operated, with comfortable yet gracious rooms and public areas. The owner was very knowledgeable and helpful. Breakfast was outstanding. Worth a detour if you find yourself in that part of Virginia and nearby West Virginia and Maryland.
reviews.title: Another great stay at Old Waterstreet Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Inn as part of a present from our children. The inn itself was warm and comfortable, as good as any we have stayed at. I cannot say enough about Jeannie. She is a wonderful hostess and her suggestions made our stay in Winchester memorable.
reviews.title: Great place, wonderful hostess, made our weekend memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent one night at the Old Waterstreet Inn on our way back home from a meeting near Washington, DC. My husband surprised me when he announced that he had made a reservation at a B&B in Winchester. (He is a business traveler and a B&B is outside his comfort zone of Hilton Garden Inns etc :) ) As we were driving in from Route 7 the surroundings changed into a quaint "old towne" feel with charming buildings and beautiful old churches. When we found the B&B, we had easy on-street parking (even though there is a parking lot in the back). The B&B is beautiful inside and out; it looks like it's right out of a magazine. We stayed in the suite that is in the upstairs of the house. I can't say enough about how warm and inviting the room felt - we loved it.
reviews.title: Warm, Gracious, and Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was as easy as calling the Inn keeper and letting her know what time we'd be there. She was warm and friendly as she showed us around the house and also gave us tips on where we were planning to go that night.
reviews.title: Beautiful Place, but Unfriendly Staff, Poor Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn is about three blocks from a pedestrian street that is full of restaurants, shops, and pubs. It was convenient to be able to walk to the restaurant and not have to drive. The location of the inn is perfect because you are close to almost anything that you want to do.
reviews.title: Don't Think Twice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast the next day was unbelievable. The inn keeper was cheerful and very gracious. We had fruit and then French toast and sausage. The food was wonderful! As other guests came in; she was able to give all the different couples the attention that we needed. My husband and I even needed to leave while others were still having breakfast (she had a full house) and she was kind enough to go and check us out.
reviews.title: A wonderful place for a special weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorry for the delay on this review! This place is absolutely perfect for a romantic long weekend getaway! This is a charming bed & breakfast set in a beautifully renovated 1840's home. The food is delicious, fresh fruit & yogurt/granola to start and then a wonderful hot breakfast of some sort (we had pancakes, quiche, and French toast the 3 days we were there). Wine and cheese at 5:30pm on the weekends. Jeanne & Eric are unbelievably accommodating, making sure the fireplace was burning in the common room as well as set-up ready to go in our room. Our room, the Winesap Room, was very romantic. Wood fireplace, comfortable queen bed, heated tile floors in the bathroom. We always had water and fresh towels. The best thing about the place is that it is a great getaway...We had plenty of privacy but somehow always felt like if we needed anything we had great hosts to provide it for us. Winchester is a small town, but is one of the most charming places we've ever visited...It is simple but in the most refreshing and uplifting way. Long story short, we definitely HIGHLY recommend this place, and we will definitely be returning for a long weekend each year and staying at the Old Waterstreet Inn!!!
reviews.title: Absolutely, 100% AMAZING!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This bed and breakfast was such a pleasant and beautifully decorated Inn. When we first arrived we were taken up to our room and the room was exactly like the photos. The room was full of character! Every morning we were served a breakfast that was really great. One aspect that we really loved was the location. The B&B was just 3 blocks from a little outdoor mall that had plenty of restaurants to choose from and we never had to drive to get to any place which definitely helps if you want to have a few cocktails to relax. We had such a nice time that we are already planning our return trip!
reviews.title: An Amazing and Relaxing Weekend!

reviews.text: On same day notice, I was booked and my special needs were accommodated!
reviews.title: Priceless Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jeannie booked my reservation with only 6 hours notice, accommodated my Gran's needs for a 1st floor room and my gluten free diet restriction. Upon arrival, she directed us to a nearby restaurant and called ahead to make certain they would seat us since it was well after the dinner hour. She was very knowledgeable about local eateries and could make recommendations based on attire, time of day and food mood. We had an absolutely delightful time at a Mediterranean-French restaurant. The food, wine and service was superb, wish I could remember the name... We walked back to the Inn, partook of tea and (guessing) Drambuie while getting ready for bed. I am very particular about beds and pillows. Jeannie makes certain you are comfortable by offering a selection of pillows and a superior mattress. My Gran and I both slept like babies.
reviews.title: A Memorable Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning was fabulous! There is a good street-side view from the dining table that sets a nostalgic ambiance. Everything from beginning to end was fresh and of high quality. The coffee and the juice were on par with the rest of the offerings and didn't make me wish for a local Starbucks. The yogurt was great, not too sour, not too sweet. All the "add-in's" were perfect. Great start and adequate should you want to keep it light on a longer stay. Then came the prepared breakfast. My Gran got the decadent looking pancakes - I can't recall the exact description because I was really trying not to drool over them as the gluten free restriction is not by choice. At any rate, she and the other guests all exclaimed over their perfection. All I can say is they smelled delicious. My eggs were so perfectly seasoned though, my disappointment over the pancake was short lived. They were savory and scrumptious!
reviews.title: Warm and welcoming with impeccable attention to comfort and details

description: A lovely 1840 home in the heart of Winchester's historic district. Walk to the quaint pedestrian street in Old Town, where you'll find shops, great restaurants, and nightlife. The casual elegance creates a charming, relaxed atmosphere. A full breakfast is included, as well as complimentary soft drinks, tea, and light snacks. Wine and cheese package available.
